thread.title: Mesut Ozil posts throwback picture showing absent Arsenal star in simpler times
thread.title_full: Mesut Ozil posts throwback picture showing absent Arsenal star in simpler times

author: Arash Hekmat
title: Mesut Ozil posts throwback picture showing absent Arsenal star in simpler times
text:
Sport Mesut Ozil posts throwback picture showing absent Arsenal star in simpler times The 28-year-old hasn't been seen for Arsenal since the FA Cup victory against Lincoln City, but has been keeping busy on social media Share Mesut Ozil posted a picture of him and his brother as kids (Photo: Arsenal FC) Share Get Arsenal FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Arsenal's Mesut Ozil has posted a throwback image of himself as a youngster with brother Mutlu in the German city of Gelsenkirchen, where the pair grew up. 
The picture shows where Mesut learned to ply his trade as one of the world's best creative playmakers - the fenced gravel pitch of the Affenkafig, or 'monkey cage'. 
Here, a young Ozil would play with his big brother and children several years his senior, refining his ability to ghost into space and thread a pass. Ozil trained this week, but picked up a hamstring injury prior to the 3-1 defeat to West Brom (Photo: Arsenal/Getty) Read More Mesut Ozil eat your heart out! Neymar leads the way in assists across Europe's top five leagues this season 
It harks back to simpler times for the German international, who is currently stalling on a new contract at the Emirates - and is reportedly considering options to leave the club. 
Ozil was left out of the squad that lost 3-1 to West Brom on Saturday with a hamstring injury, although he has not yet been ruled out of the Germany squad for Saturday's friendly against England . 
The 28-year-old has increased his goal tally this term, but struggled to replicate the same sort of creative impact that he made last year, when he notched up 19 Premier League assists, one shy of Thierry Henry's all-time record. Read More Ozil was last seen in action for Arsenal against Lincoln in the FA Cup (Photo: Rex Features) The German came on as a substitute (Photo: Ian Walton) poll loading Will Mesut Ozil leave Arsenal this summer? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
